Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mimiandgui
Reviews.Content: Lovely apartments with kitchenette and seating area, bedroom and shower/loo. Access to laundry. Iron/board in room. Very nicely decorated, cleaned every day (except Sundays). Very convenient location with a number of useful shops, cafes a short stroll away and the metro close by to take you to the tourist spots around Paris. An excellent place to stay if you are in Paris for a long weekend or longer. The only negative was the early morning noise from the bakery next door - but the smell was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Jessica R
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here, there were three of us in a one bedroom appartment (with one of us on the sofa bed) The accommodation was clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful. Although the hotel is a bit of a walk from all the tourist attractions it is close enough to the metro and if you choose to walk it is a nice stroll along the river. There is a lovely patisserie just around the corner for a lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jbuntrick
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Hotel Home Paris. Virginie (and all of the other staff) was very helpful with dinner reservations and very friendly. The 2 bedroom has lots of space and accommodated me and and my 3 friends very well. MUCH easier than renting an apartment through an agency as you don't have to worry about cleaning and large deposits. Merci! Lots of great bakeries and the metro is near by. Free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Apartment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: The-SCH-world
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Hotel Home Paris 16 in December 2011. The apartment is well equiped, and it has a lift ( max 2 pax) which is very useful. The location of this apartment is great, with Jasmin metro about 100m away, a Chinese restaurant about 15m, and some convenient store nearby, with a bakery adjacent to it which open at 7.30am. Wonderful! We had a good time in Paris, partly because this apartment stay is good, convenient, and a good 3 bedroom for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Home 16 - Perfect Family Getaway in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeslieM1717
Reviews.Content: We recently just finished our second stay at Hotel Home 16 in Paris. Both times we had a multi-generational vacation -- grandmother, mom, aunt, teen daughter, neice, friend. Hotel Home 16 gives us all the room we need, in a perfect location in the heart of the beautiful 16th -- a clean, safe, elegant area with shops, bakeries, lovely restaurants and easy metro access. The managment is top notch and help with your every need from a car or taxi at the airport to making dinner reservations. The rooms are well appointed and extremely comfortable and we have enjoyed appetizers and cocktails in the garden, as well as coffee and croissants in our comfortable kitchen/living room area in the morning. This family of travelers will be back to Hotel Home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice surrouning”
Reviews.Author: AntonJan
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Hotel Home Paris. The hotel has a good price/quality level. It is near to the Underground. There are several bakeries in the neigbourhood (every day there is at least one open), so you can arrange a very fresh and tasty breakfast. The sofa-bed is not the best bed you can imagine, but for three days it's OK. For a longer stay I would recommend a larger appartment (we were with 4 persons in a 4-person appartment) so everyone would be able to sleep on a normal bed.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Parisian Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Natalie K
Reviews.Content: Hotel home is a fabulous location in the heart of residential Paris. It is super close to all attractions by metro, and it is an authentic Parisian neighbourhood that is not "touristy". Amazing bistros within 2-5 minutes walk. Metro 5 minutes. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tinaandgeoff
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 adults stayed here for 2 nights in a 1 twin bedded apartment, no. 11 on the 1st floor. The location was excellent. We faced the inner courtyard, so no traffic noise. Maybe we were just lucky, but everyone was quiet at night. Security tight, so that our visitor was questioned at the front door before being allowed in. Facilities first rate. Everything you need, including a small welcome pack. The doors separating all the rooms gave much needed privacy to my 20 year old son-most other holiday apartments don't have this.

Reviews.Title: “excelent place for relaxing after the round trip”
Reviews.Author: tom c
Reviews.Content: we stayed in that really nice place for two nights only after our round trip on Paris It was really relaxing stay with all commodity you need.

Reviews.Title: “Midnight in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: well-travelledmom
Reviews.Content: My daughters (10, 14 years) and I stayed for 9 nights here. The accommodations are simple, clean and somewhat stylish. A concierge is available to help you in the morning for several hours. It was ample space for the 3 of us, although the sleeper sofa was not amazingly comfortable. I would take a 2 bedroom next time. We felt like Parisians living in the residential 16th. We stocked our fridge with snacks and went out for breakfast everyday at a local bakery where we heard real Parisians ordering coffee, bread and croissants, and so we were able to expand our knowledge of French. The Jasmin Metro took us everywhere as well as taxis. We also walked to Passy for shopping. We saw all the major attractions and even visited the Eiffel tower at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great value”
Reviews.Author: carolyn8298
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most beautiful spacious suites room we stayed. its not always easy to find suitable accommodation at a reasonable price.We stayed three nights ,it proved to be very enjoyable not only because of the large suite but we also loved the hotel's location and some of the nearby restaurants,The staff were absolutely wonderful, friendly, helpful and I really felt like I was staying in a home away from home. They seemed to be very happy working there, always smiling, ready to help guests, talking pleasantly amongst themselves etc. It seemed like they enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Vinhasjr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cozy and comfy. It´s located in a very quiet area surrounded by cafés, pizza restaurants and a good boulangerie. I would recommend it to people travelling with young kids as the apartments are spacious and equipped with a small kitchen. On the down side, I´d say they should try to fix the abscence of sound insulation, because the wooden floor is quite noise.

Reviews.Title: “A spacious place to "live" in Paris - your very own apartment with the benefits of hotel service”
Reviews.Author: karent005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last month and it's now the third tiime I have stayed there. With a living room and a kitchen, it feels like you have a proper base in Paris and not just squashed into a hotel room. That said, the rooms are clearned and beds made every day and there is always someone at reception if you need help. There is a gorgeous bakery around the corner (actually there are 3 in very close proximity) and a lovely local corner grocers. The 3 girls I came to Paris with had never stayed there before and were all raving about it at the end. I thoroughly recommend it! If I had a niggle - the decor is startng to look a little tired around the edges and could do with a refresh!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TassiePrue
Reviews.Content: Hotel Home Paris is in a great location and everything we needed was close by supermarket, bakery, pharmacy, nice restaurants and the metro. We stayed in a Double Suite and it was perfect for our group of two couples. The apartment was very cute. The kitchen was small but functional, the lounge room was a good size and we loved having a balcony so we could watch people in the street below. The terrace on the ground floor was really nice but we didnt get a chance to use it. There weren't any major negatives but two things to note are that there wasn't really a shower just a bath with a hand held shower attachment at waist height so we all had sitting down showers, but looking at the website it does only say bath and not shower so I just didn't read closely enough! Also the lift was tiny - we couldn't even fit two suitcases in it so we chose to walk up to the 3rd floor. The staff were helpful and we would stay here again and I would recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Loueze
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, very clean, super bathroom, lovely inner courtyard almost mini garden with little tables and lots of plants. Peaceful stay. The room was a little musty on arrival, but perhaps that was due to all the recent heavy rain and so the windows had to be kept closed. I'd definitely stay there again. Just 2 minutes from a metro stop

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Salvador
Reviews.Content: We rented this place to stay with friends while attending the Roland Garros. The location was convenient for the tournament but it's also a nice residential and local neighborhood. The Jasmin metro stop is conveniently located close to the hotel and connects you to the center of the city. The unit was in good condition and clean. It served very well our purpose. The staff were kind and helpful at all times. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nous avons adoré avec les enfants et nous y retournerons”
Reviews.Author: Elen18
Reviews.Content: We loved the family apartment with our small kids (3 and 6 years). The entrance had a good size, the living room was big considering the usually small hotel rooms in Paris. The bedsofa was of a good quality, although it consisted of two separate beds instead of one bed, which my husband and I would have preferred. The bedroom and the living room had on the fifth floor two lovely small balconies, which we loved. As we live on a quiet countryside, I had to get used to the noise street during the night, although it was not too excessive and very usual in a city like Paris. I got used to it and the kids and my husband didn't hear anything. The kitchen was modern and small, but so well equipped and I loved the small dishwasher and the microwave. Water and teabags were ready as a welcome package. The first day the cleaning lady washed even our dishes, that we forgot, but unfortunately she didn't on the second day. We weren't sure, if this service is included. However, the beds and bathroom were done every day. The bathroom was just great. Full of daylight and the huge nice tub. Our kids just loved it. We felt as if we had an apartment of our own in Paris and we will definitively come back again with the kids. Also because the neighbourhood was so peaceful and with hardly any tourists. The bakery and grocery shop just downstairs were very convenient and there were many small restaurants. The metro station is just 2min away and on a very good line to the Trocadero (5min) and the Champs-Elysees (8min). In a 5min walk you are just at the Seine and say hello to the Statue of Liberty and the Eiffel Tower. Great for people who want to avoid the great tourist mass in Paris, but really feel at home in Paris. It felt good after a day of sightseeing to come back to this neighbourhood and get a quiet and peaceful rest. We had a wonderful stay!!!! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Roland Garros”
Reviews.Author: williamsc29
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights with friends in a two-bedroom unit that also included a den with a pull-out couch. The unit was very comfortable, and the staff worked hard to be helpful. Free internet is included for one computer per unit, and the free laundry room in the basement was a big help. I would highly recommend this hotel for travelers to Roland Garros. The location is a little on the outskirts of the city for general travel but certainly not too far away to present any big problems, and the Jasmin metro stop is very convenient. I agree with a prior post that the beds could use updating, but overall, this hotel was an excellent value and a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If they would buy new beds it would be the best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and slept in three rooms looking for a good bed. There are two twin beds in a 3 bedroom apt. that are the deep suportative great beds, otherwise all the double beds are 7" thin and very worn out, box springs are worthless. The owner is busy renovating the rooms one at a time, so new paint, wall paper, art, and carpet, the newly renovated rooms are beautiful. Some rooms face the sun and some face the courtyard, if you face the courtyard count on a early morning wake up as there is a bakery that shares the courtyard and they get to work at 5:30AM, they keep the windows open and make a lot of noise talking and laughing, we kept our windows closed but that didn't help. If she were to replace the beds then this is just a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice nest in traditional Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dad95
Reviews.Content: This place isn't a common hotel it really feels like "your home in Paris". The accomodation is large (we had a double room appartment) nicely furbished in a traditional way. Kitchen and bathroom are pleasant and perfectly functional. It has been very easy to settle in and we immediately felt comfortable. There is a very good bakery 20 meters away where sandwhiches pies etc... can be puchased and several small food markets nearby that are open till very late at night. The area and the building are quiet. We have not been bothered by noise from the other appartments. The metro is 5 mn away. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, clean, a home from home”
Reviews.Author: johntharme
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and enjoyable stay, easy directions on the website from the airport. Stayed one week for a language course, the suite was well appointed, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Our Apartment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SWKA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here. We stayed here in the first week of January and had an apartment at the front of the building on the first floor. These rooms are slightly noisy as they face the street but have more character than the back rooms. Our room was spacious with high ceilings , separate entry , large combined sitting/dining room, separate bedroom, bathroom and kitchen. We find the 16th Arrondisement to be a convenient and quiet residential area with local shops and markets (Rue de Passy). Try the patisserie around the corner for breakfast provisions - you can smell the croissants cooking at 4am!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marsnicolas
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful hotel! We spend 2 nights there and cant recommend it more. Great stuff, great food, affordable! Location is little bit out of the city, but quiet and well worth it! It is palced next to the big forest, so during the day you can take a walk or even a morning running. This was the first time we looked on tripadvisor for a hotel and we were lucky to find this one!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent and convenient”
Reviews.Author: upi63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a marbellous position, close to the metro and one of the most beautiful sites of the town. It is clean, the manager is absolutely a gentlewoman and the flat (quite a big one) is well strctured with a talented taste for modern solutions. I stayed with my family and both the TV and WIFI services were perfectly suited to surf the website and enjoy the free time. So, I would like to suggest the Hotel Home 16 to all my friends and, also, my colleagues. Try it as a marvellous substitute of a Hotel room. You will enjoy the freedom of a flat suited for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “I love this quaint hotel in the beautiful non tourist area of Paris the 16th arrondissement. Staff are so lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: ReillyMc
Reviews.Content: HotelHome is in a beautiful Hausmannian building in the 16th arrondissement which is very close to the very beautiful and large park Bois de Boulogne. If you want romance go to the main lake in the park called Lac inferior and make sure to rent a small rowing boat and row over to the island. There you can picnic or check out the restaurant. Only for the view of the Eiffel Tower one would think they were in the countryside!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe23
Reviews.Content: The apartment we booked was large for Paris standards, equipped kitchen and clean bathroom. The staff is very very friendly and helpful! We arrived earlier and they let us use a small room till our apartment was ready.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend the Junior Suites.”
Reviews.Author: Bronte011
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 days in a Junior Suite. These suites are in a wing of the hotel that does not have a lift and i suspect these suites are not the subjects of the very positive reviews on TripAdvisor. My suite was dark and gloomy. While the bathroom was excellent, the rest needed a lot more lighting and an update. The so-called lounge had a bed and an oversized sideboard, not a sofa or comfortable chairs. The dining area was very cramped with a low stool the only seating. The apartment was warm and, as other reviewers have said, the hotel is well run and well kept, with friendly and helpful staff, and in a pleasant neighbourhood. However, I cannot recommend the Junior Suites.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSince68
Reviews.Content: This is a residence more than a hotel. If you want to know how the parisians live, this is the place. My husband and I stayed 15 nights because of work, in a two room 45sqm apartment. It was perfect, specially the service. Cleaning includes vacuum cleaning every day...not even in 5 star hotels... The only thing we would improve is the internet service provider. Wi-fi is free, but not very reliable. Having said that we managed to work around it. We have been in France constantly for the past 5 years, and this is one of the best places to stay. We will stay there again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “thank you for a great holidays”
Reviews.Author: elenavasilieva
Reviews.Content: Very good service, very nice rooms and very very helpful and friendly personal. Thanks for your professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: Justmian
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Home Paris 16 for the first four nights of my stay in Paris, mainly because of the positive reviews I have read about the hotel on the tripadvisor forum. It turned out to be a very good start to my Europe tour! I must admit that I was initially a little apprehensive about the quaint little lift that has just enough standing room for 2 persons! But eventually that was of little consequence to me for I was so wowed by the self-sufficient apartment, the warm bathroom (really heavenly on cold December days) and the top-notch housekeeping service! I'm grateful to Virginia who welcomes guests at the reception. Over the next few days, she ensured that every request, be it a request for internet service or dishwasher detergent, was quickly and sufficiently met. But what impressed me most was the service provided by the chambermaids. Our room was always fresh and clean when we returned to the hotel from a day of sightseeing. I was in a particular rush one morning and left a couple of pots unwashed. To my pleasant surprise, I returned at the end of the day to find the unwashed pots done! All ready in the dishwasher for my next use! Thank you, ladies, for going the extra mile! I also love the bathroom, which was always cosy and warm. The heater was fantastic! It certainly does wonders to a tired soul back from the freezing cold outside. All in all, the well-located Hotel Home Paris 16, with its impeccable service and yet affordable price, gives true value for money - something so hard to come by in pricy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: SB-Paris-75016
Reviews.Content: As someone who visits Paris once a month, I have been trying out several hotels in the 16e and i have to say that the Home Hotel is top of my list , my first stay was an excellent experience starting with my initial booking right thru to my late arrival & departure, what was particularly good was the heating as I visited during a particularly cold & snowy w/e so when it was -5 outside it was nice to return to a warm appt I will ceratinly be returning to the Home Hotel again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “perfect Parisien place to stay with all amenities nearby”
Reviews.Author: lizd123
Reviews.Content: well situated in a residential non touristy area . Close to metro and all buses virtually on doorstep. Travelling with my mother and almost teenage daughter, we stayed in a family suite for 3 nights. The apartment was spotless and very comfortable, the bathrooms had recently been refurbished and it was nice to be able to have a hot shower. When we remarked that the radiator was not working properly in one room this was fixed immediately without hassle. Our relatives lived in the same street so were able to pop in with supplies and the management and reception staff were so helpful and friendly and on hand when we needed anything. It was an adventure squeezing into the narrow quaint lift to 6th floor, which added to the enjoyment. Perfectly situated near the wonderful bakery next door open for breakfast supplies. No. 72 bus very near to take us fiteen minutes to the sites. Some nice restaurants nearby . We would certainly stay here again much better than a noisy hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: RodicaS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much in our one week stay. Very good location. Everyday room cleaning. Quiet enviroment and the staff is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sanctuary from a Parisian heatwave”
Reviews.Author: SuzieoM
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay in the three bedroomed apartment, which we shared with friends en route from Tanzania to the US. From the moment we arrived, the service could not have been better. Laurence personally took my husband to the underground car park around the corner and the cost was added to our bill. The location is perfect and we were able to get to CDG in little over half an hour to meet our friends. With two metro stations close by, there is quick and easy access to the centre of the city and there is a Velib station within 100m of the Hotel, which we also used. The suite was spacious. We were able to accommodate nine comfortably for breakfast one morning (including friends who had rented an apartment on the ground floor). Paris was in the grip of an intolerable heatwave when we arrived and the air-conditioning was extremely welcome. The rooms were all clean and the kitchen was surprisingly well-equipped. The bathrooms were obviously renovated recently and the showers were spacious and efficient. The area has a village atmosphere and there are plenty of good restaurants locally. The sushi takeaway on the right just past the Jasmin Metro station is excellent - we bought bento boxes for a picnic lunch and they were excellent value and quality. The arondissement is very safe, so much so that we were happy to walk back from the Eiffel Tower at midnight with our two teenaged daughters. For people who want to have more freedom and space than a conventional hotel combined with a more personal level of service, it would be difficult to find anything better in Paris for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: StutterheimName
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, experience the true Parisien lifestyle. Easliy accessible, near 2 metro and bus stops near front door. Apartment comfortable, clean and well equiped. Friendly and professional service, they went out of their way to make our stay more comfortable. Limit luggage for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Haysam_Kahale
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time staying there, a bit far from the center of attraction but that did not deter us as the metro and bus was close by and could get to where we wanted easily. The rooms was clean, bathroom specially was very clean, and the kitchen was very good and had all the utensils needed for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, roomy, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeterDWalmsley
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. The location, away from the bustle and chaos of tourist Paris in an haute bourgeois art deco suburb, is a very strong attraction. To return there after a long day in the crowds is deeply pleasurable. It is spacious, too, unlike most Parisian hotels. The staff are very friendly. We too loved going to the boulangerie and making our own breakfasts. The bed was perhaps a little hard; that is our only grumble. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay - Home from Home with added luxury”
Reviews.Author: KatyB_10
Reviews.Content: Experienced fantastic service, organised, friendly but professional, helpful Have stayed twice and both times apartment rooms were spotless, beautifully decorated in Parisian style The location is perfect - just out of centre and more upmarket residential but only 3 stops away from the Champs Elysees so on top of everything. Everything on hand close by for provisions/restaurants/metro/taxis. Feel totally 'safe' in area to walk around in evening The fact that each room is a mini apartment gives a feeling of enjoying staying in a luxury home but with all amenities of a hotel The courtyard garden is also a bonus where you can sit and enjoy breakfast or an evening drink if the weather is warm

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LisaToo
Reviews.Content: Since we were traveling with teenagers I started my search looking for a place that would offer us lots of room. The largest apartment here is three bedrooms and there was an extra sofa bed in the living room. There were two modern bathrooms. The small kitchen was convenient so we did not have to eat out every meal, and there were several close supermarkets and restaurants with take out (plats a emporter). There was a living/dining room where we could eat together. The people running the Hotel were friendly and helpful with restaurants, shopping and transportation. Their English was better than my French! It is an old building, so if you are looking for glitz and luxury this isn't the place. But it felt as if we were living in Paris! There is air conditioning which we needed, and many windows that open to catch cool breezes. It is located in a quiet part of the city, but there was some noise at night if this bothers. We stayed three places in Europe and this was our favorite experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a cozy and CLEAN place in Paris, don't look any further!”
Reviews.Author: ronluda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Home is an absolutely perfect place to stay in Paris. Just steps away from the Metro station. 4 metro stops to the Eiffel Tower (you can even walk there if you are able to, but we prefered to use the Metro, since our kids are small), 30 minutes from the Versailles. We took metro/train to Hotel from EuroDisney (which took us about 45 minutes) and it was very easy to find! Very safe neighborhood! If you want to live like a Parisian, this is a place to stay! Bakery is in the same building, so you can get fresh croissants every morning and make your own coffee, since cappuccinos are 4.50 Euro in Paris, you can save a lot of money just on it. Groccery store is a 5 minute walk away, small market to get fresh fruit and veggies is right there by the groccery store, and I've seen it there at least three times, I assume it's an everyday morning event. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, beds are comfortable. Kids enjoyed sleeping on a hide-a-bed in the livingroom (we had a deluxe suite). A teakettle, a coffee maker, pots and pans, even a small dishwasher, everything you need to make a dinner, small refrigrator! AC or heater, whatever you need to make your stay like HOME. There was always plenty of hot water, actually the shower is super nice, mordern, updated. Everything in the hotel is very well taken care of, SUPER CLEAN. I could let my baby crawl everywhere and I knew that it's all safe and clean for her. The service is excellent! Professional, friendly, helpful staff, they all spoke good English. The laundry room is in the basement downstairs, we were given laundry detergent for free! Just remember, European washers and dryers take a lot longer to wash and dry your clothes. There are so many nice touches about HotelHome Paris 16, like L'Occitaine soap and shampoo, super professional maid service, it all adds up to a perfect Paris vacation!!! We were given a WiFi card with access code and had Internet in our room, and it was free! There were no surprise charges of any kind! I would go back there in a heart beat and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Dragon97
Reviews.Content: My husband, our son and I stayed here for four nights in June, when were on a three-city Europe holiday. The apartment was easy to find by taxi, and it was very convenient to the metro and to move around the city. We liked the location, in a nice, friendly neighbourhood (two people helped us translate English to French for our purchase in the local bakery!), and the staff were most helpful, ensuring our taxi was booked for our trip to the airport when we left. The one bedroom apartment was really quiet and comfortable (it was the most comfortable and best equipped we had in the three cities), and spacious. Great value for the price.We really don't have any complaints at all; and we will certainly recommend this to our friends for a nice play to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to spend time in Paris with your family”
Reviews.Author: calliezhou
Reviews.Content: Very spacious apartment, equipped kitchen and clean bathroom. My whole family enjoyed staying at HotelHome. Also the staff is very very friendly and helpful! Definitely recommend this to any family that wish to have a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious!”
Reviews.Author: giada0
Reviews.Content: Everything about this accommodation was excellent. Mme. Poignant was exceptionally kind and made us feel very welcome. From our first email enquiry through our weeklong stay to our check out, the professionalism mixed with friendliness and organizational efficiency at Hotelhome16 made this a winner for us. The suite was decorated in the period style of the building, and the kitchen and bathroom were new and very well outfitted. Care, attention to detail and cleanliness were evident everywhere. This is our favourite type of hotel--small, friendly, a residential neighbourhood with local shops and restaurants, no fast-food, coffee chains, or mega-stores and off the tourist track. Not for everyone but we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great to have the space”
Reviews.Author: ursilaj
Reviews.Content: Great to have space, esp in Paris where it is at a premium. We had a 1 bed apt with a pull out sofa bed for our son in the living room. The pull out was not too comfortable (though fine for a kid) but other than that we were very pleased with the apartment. Nice toileteries and kitchen very thoughtfully stocked with tea/ coffee.

Reviews.Title: “a real taste of living in a French home with staff who make you feel like family!”
Reviews.Author: Family5Colchester
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a large apartment on the 5th floor and found it be ideal for our needs as we were out and about the whole time. Had we been in for the evening, the 5 of us would have been a little compromised by the fact that there was a 2 seater settee and then formal dining chairs so not an easy space for us all to chill out together, Bathrooms gorgeous and we fell in love with bath products! Croissants, pastries from a fab range of local boulangeries and delis would have been nicer re heated in a small real oven but that's just me being picky as everyone else was more than happy with the well kitted out kitchenette (microwave, hob and lots of crockery, pans etc) A small tray of tea, coffee, hot chocolate sachets and maybe milk and one bottle of mineral water in the fridge every day, would have been a lovely extra wish if possible. The staff were wonderful and we were treated so kindly when we were caught up in the volcanic ash plane delay! We phoned from the airport and were told straight away we could return for as long as we wished and we were allocated a simpler apartment that would help with the cost of what turned out to be an additional 5 nights! An extra bed was put in at no extra cost and we stayed for free on the Sunday. This apartment was again very well set out and spotlessly clean. We enjoyed looking out over the street and people watching from the balcony although the downside was that on the first floor now we had very disturbed night's sleep because of the extremely noisy traffic building up at the corner junction from time to time. The local area was wonderful and we made friends with lovely folk in the boulangerie next door and in the Village Restaurant where we went for the 3rd time on our last night and were given free drinks and delightfully gallic embraces as we left and promised to return! Hotel Home became our second home and we can't wait to return. Friends and family have already been encouraged to visit too and the lovely ladies there deserve every success with their warm and elegant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, convenient location, good for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: Spent five days in Hotel Home Paris 16 and had a splendid time. Staff was very attentive, particularly the front desk: giving us great suggestions for itineraries, checking us in and out promptly and efficiently, and even returning laundry up to our room after we had left it in the basement. Upkeep was fine and the housekeeping was attentive. Location isn't necessarily close to any major attractions, but is extremely convenient off the 9 Metro line Jasmin station. Very close to a couple of aromatic bakeries and a functional wine store. Suite was fine for a family with small children; decent amount of space and functional kitchen and bathroom at a very good value. I would definitely recommend this apartment to others rather than getting a kitchenless, laundryless hotel room for a lot higher daily rate. The only complaint on the room was that the wood floors in the main room were really creaky! Otherwise, a great gem for someone interested in apartment living for a longer-term stay to spend exploring the city of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: odisseasST
Reviews.Content: Lovely apartment, situating in a nice neighbourhood and close to the metro station. The hotel staff was very helpful and the rooms are clean and cosy. Kitchen with all necessary facilities in a good condition, spacious bathroom and lovely bedspreads. Hope to stay there again !!! Odisseas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: MReine
Reviews.Content: excellent location, and great services. Clean, quiet with far more space than a hotel room. The personel were very flexible and reliable. Located next to the Metro, bus and many taxis coming in the main street. Will come again in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: deljen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights here and we are struggling to see why people rate it quite so highly. In general hotel terms it would surely rank no higher than 3 stars. Let me qualify first by saying that we chose an apartment as there were 4 of us and we were hoping for a living area where we could chill out in the evenings rather than having to use a hotel bar. Just somewhere to sit and chat in between the day's sightseeing and going out for an evening meal and then at the end of the evening. Unfortunately the living area was cramped and uncomfortable. We had the family suite on the 5th floor which sleeps up to 6. The living area has 1 two seater sofa (not very comfortable) and a dining table with 4 chairs. Had there been 6 of us it would have been very cramped. Even with 4 of us it just wasn't comfortable.and not somewhere that we wanted to sit for any length of time. Based on the price we paid, we would have been as good in a reasonable hotel. As others have said the kitchens are small and very basic but given we only used it for breakfast it was more than adequate. The bedrooms were also a bit on the small side. The main bedroom was well furnished but the other two bedrooms were very basic and lacked cupboards in one of them, bedside tables and bedside lamps but they were adequate for a 4 night stay and they were clean. There is a maid service to make the beds and clean the bathrooms each day. On the plus side, the hotel is in a residential area quite a way out of the tourist part of Paris but only a 15 minute Metro journey away. It only took us 30 minutes to walk to the Eifeel Tower and it was a very pleasant stroll. There are lots of little shops and restaurants around and we felt that we were living as locals rather than as tourists. However, on the two weekdays we were there, we were awoken at 4.30 each morning to lots of banging which we think must be the Boulangerie/Patisserie in the same block. Good restaurants nearby are Bistrot 31 (excellent) on Rue Theophile Gautier and Brandevin (very good) on Rue du Dr Blanche. As it's off the tourist track little English is spoken but both were very welcoming and served good food and are within 5 minutes walk.. If there was just the two of us we might be inclined to stay here again if we could get a decent rate but for a group it just wasn't what we had been looking for.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: lgolinker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful 8 days in Paris from Oct 11-19, 2009. The hotel is located in a beautiful neighborhood, akin to -- but nicer (and much, much quieter) than -- a side street on the upper east side of Manhattan. The broad, tree lined, main street (R. de Mozart) invites strolling. It is a 25 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower or just a few blocks to 2 different Metro lines. On a map, the hotel appears far from the center of Paris, but the Metro puts all of Paris just minutes away. This very upscale residential neighborhood has wonderful bakeries, cheese shops, small groceries and prepared food take-out food shops, which we tried several times. We ate our main meal of the day at lunch and ate lighter fare for dinner. After days sightseeing and shopping, returning to the hotel for a light meal and relaxing was a welcome opportunity. Parisians also eat dinner quite late. We stayed in Apartment 12 on the second floor. It had a very large and comfortable bedroom with plenty of illumination and ample storage space; a bathroom with a stall shower and plenty of hot water; and a fully stocked apartment-sized kitchen. After a week's stay in several quite small hotel rooms while in Provence, this apartment was a very pleasant change. It also had several large windows opening onto a courtyard that provided fresh air but no noise. The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful. This included several pre-trip and post-trip e-mails, as well as during our stay. Happily, we had very few needs. An on-site laundry is a convenience, but there also are several laundries nearby in the neighborhood. Overall, this hotel was a great find. It offered more room at less cost and in a much nicer neighborhood than many other hotels in Paris. We would love to return (who ever says they have "had enough" of Paris?) and we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable! - I'll definitely return!"”
Reviews.Author: SoloBob
Reviews.Content: Based on other travellers' reviews, I decided to give Hotel Home 16 a try on my visit to Paris last week, and I am very pleased that I did. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, and my (admittedly poor) French was not an obstacle to communication :) The rooms are closer to apartments than hotel suites, with bedroom, living room, kitchen and bathroom; and mine, on the third floor, overlooked the street. The kitchen, while small, contained everything required to prepare a decent meal if desired, and groceries were to be had from one of many shops on the Ave Mozart. I'm very fond of Paris, and will return - especially now I have somewhere to return to!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Home Paris 16
HotelInfo.Address: 36 rue George Sand | 16 Arr., 75016 Paris, France
